ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about energy markets in the United States and some general energy principles.
Survey of the global energy landscape from 30,000 feet. Basic fluency in energy topics.
different types of energy, their pros and cons. the current state of the world in terms of energy sources, and energy sectors.
How to make real assessments of the energy profile of a country

Great foundational knowledge of energy systems
Electricity markets
Land area as an energy metric

I learned about energy industries worldwide, and their histories, and trends. I chose a country that I focused on personally, and was able to learn a ton about the energy of this country in particular.
good

This course is a survey on world energy that jumps around a huge amount. Don't expect to have conclusions drawn for you or go into a huge amount of depth on any subject, but a lot of information is presented to you and it is up to you to take from it and learn what you want to learn. This is often in the form of statistics and graphs that present interesting and important information on energy and climate in today's world.

This course gave a broad overview of world energy, the assignments were quick to do and interesting, but I think that if you come in with general environmental/energy knowledge you won't learn tons of new content.
Broad base on energy topics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course assignments felt disorganized.

Strengths: Instructor. He's clearly the right person for the job.
Weaknesses: honestly, the classroom was not very conducive to learning or peer-to-peer interaction. Please relocate.
strengths: great range of lessons structures e.g. we did team presentations, debates, lectures, and bidding simulations
I loved the fact that the projects are very real and applicable, and you feel like you actually learn from them.
The course structure is great! The group exercises and presentations are great opportunities for student growth.

I thought that both of the group projects were great. The land area exercise and the debate. Both of them had the class working together, researching deep into topics, and engaging with each other in class. Otherwise, the classes sometimes ended up just being 1 hour 50 min lectures.
ood

Strengths: Presents important information in a fairly organized manner and gives a good overview of different topics. Oristaglio also cares about the subject a lot and knows a great deal. Weaknesses: It is hard to have a true seminar with the number of people who were in the class this semester, so it was more of a lecture course presented as a seminar and with group projects.
Lots of freedom to choose your own topics, didn't learn a ton of new information.
Covers a lot of ground, with fun group projects to stay engaged. Would have liked to meet twice a week. Wanted more!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This course is required for Energy Studies (I think?), and it's not overly difficult. I was just frustrated by the structure of some of the projects and the disconnect between professor, TA, and students. Communication on details of assignments, or more accurately, any questions about them, were not clear.
It's required for the ENRG certificate so I'm afraid you don't have a choice! But it is actually quite fun.
yes if you are into energy! Oristaglio knows everything and anything under the sun about energy.
Yes, if you are interested in energy this is a great course
Yes! For those who are new to the energy space, this is a great foundational course!
Yes! Oristaglio is the man for teaching this subject. Great course, with not the highest commitment. Take the class if you are interested in energy.
good

Yes - there aren't many other courses that cover the same information and it is important information to know. With that said, it is up to you to take out as much information as possible, which comes from the effort you put in.
Yes, this is a fun 5th credit with interesting assignments that doesn't ask a ton of you.
Yes, if you are in energy studies.
